comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Thinking the cranes at Milsons Point and Dawes Point are beginning to build the Harbour Bridge,  so late 1920s?

C'mon ferry experts,  go wild! ... ...

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Where's Graeme Andrews when you need him? That ferry appears to be the Barragoola, not Barracoola. See some small images of the Barragoola and Balgowlah ferries and others on Graeme Andrew's site: www.shf.org.au/GAndrewsFiles/Ferries.html

comment.author: 21624712@N07
comment._content: My favourite ferry, the Barragoola. Loved travelling on this especially home from work on a summer's afternoon.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/corinneski]  Yikes thanks for picking up the typo in the title there & for the extra historical details :) Our records have been updated. More ferry pics to come!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/corinneski] I'm with you Corinneski - my favourite ferry as well!
